text:
Perhaps the most famous
nickname for Boston is Beantown,
but we are also called The Hub.

And I think that's a pretty
accurate nickname when
it comes to the life sciences.

Boston has the largest
biotech cluster in the nation,

the most life science
PhD graduates,

and the most money invested in
biotech startups in the world.

It is also home to
cutting-edge innovation.

All three COVID-19
vaccines approved

for emergency use
in the United States

were researched or produced
in the Boston area.

Students who come to
Harvard Business School

not only have access to
world-renowned faculty

and facilities, but
a direct connection

to the vast biotech and life
science community of Boston

that is literally
second to none.

Whether you're pursuing
an MS/MBA, a life science

fellowship such as the Blavatnik
Fellowship in Life Science

Entrepreneurship, or an
entrepreneurial venture

in biotech, HBS has the
resources, the network,

and, of course,
the best location
to help you achieve your goals.
